title: 2024 US presidential election calendar: Primaries, Trump's trials, and more key dates
summary: Donald Trump's multiple trials are scheduled to run from January to August, in parallel with the race to obtain the Republican nomination for president of the United States. The marathon begins in Iowa on Monday, January 15.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'We all know that a purely military solution is not the appropriate answer'
summary: Josep Borrell, the head of European diplomacy, proposes a plan to prevent the Israeli-Palestinian conflict from spreading to Lebanon and 'break the spiral of violence in the Middle East.'

title: Cyclone Belal 'didn't cause the cataclysm we might have feared' on France's Réunion Island
summary: Initial reports from local authorities indicate that the French Indian Ocean island department suffered one fatality, widespread power outages and significant disruptions to its drinking water supply networks. Road conditions are still uncertain.

title: Davos 2024: Picking up the pieces of fractured capitalism
summary: At the World Economic Forum, which began on Monday, January 15, political and business leaders will gather in Switzerland for a week to ponder the state of the world against a backdrop of ever-increasing geopolitical, technological and climate risks.

title: Houthi rebels continue attacks on US cargo ships
summary: Houthi rebels launched a missile that hit a US-owned ship on Monday near Yemen's coast in the Gulf of Aden, intensifying the already high tensions in the Red Sea following American-led strikes on the rebels.

title: French education minister under fire over swipe at public schools
summary: Amélie Oudéa-Castéra said her children were attending private school because there had been 'loads of teaching hours without a serious replacement' teacher at her son's public school. But news reports cast doubts on her version of the story.

title: New Zealand's government veers hard right
summary: Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has had to join forces with 'anti-woke' nationalists and libertarians to form a coalition that is primarily aimed at dismantling the progressive legacy of Labor's Jacinda Ardern.

title: Footage of Cyclone Belal hitting France's Réunion Island
summary: The island has returned to red alert status after being placed on the highest alert, violet, on Monday morning, due to the passage of the potentially devastating cyclone.

title: Opponents of France's immigration law take to street protests
summary: Several thousand people marched on Sunday across France to demand the withdrawal of the restrictive bill adopted by Parliament. Another day of demonstrations will be held next Sunday, ahead of the Constitutional Council's ruling on the law on January 25.

title: Two French school heads charged with failing to report child abuse
summary: One has admitted that she had thought she should make a report, but that she didn't do it, mainly because she 'didn't have time.' The other school head has denied his responsibility. They are facing five years' imprisonment and a €75,000 fine.

title: Lai Ching-te's victory in Taiwan calls China's strategy into question
summary: The third consecutive election in Taiwan of a pro-independence presidential candidate on Saturday, January 13, demonstrated the Taiwanese people's mistrust towards mainland China. In response, Beijing has stepped up its threats.

title: Iran releases two journalists who covered the death of Mahsa Amini
summary: Two months ahead of the parliamentary elections, Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi, convicted at a trial in October, have been released from prison on bail pending their appeal.

title: Paris's Louvre museum hikes prices almost 30%
summary: The price of tickets to enter the world's most visited museum rose from €17 to €22. It cited rising energy costs as a justification.

title: 'In China, a new ill omen has emerged: Deflation'
summary: Beijing is betting on industry, with massive funding for metallurgy, automobiles and electrical equipment. It could lead to overcapacity with devastating consequences for the planet, writes economic columnist Philippe Escande.

title: Iceland volcano eruption leaves houses on fire as lava spills into small town
summary: Houses in the town of Grindavik were in flames after lava from the Sundhnjukagigar volcano seeped into the small town.

title: 2024: A crucial year for climate diplomacy
summary: More than half the world's voting-age population is set to go to the polls this year, including in India and the US, major greenhouse gas emitters.

title: German farmers protest against fuel subsidy cuts in Berlin
summary: Farmers drove thousands of tractors into the capital as the culmination of a week of demonstrations against Scholz's center-left government's plan to cut tax breaks on diesel, at a time of deep general public discontent.

title: At Davos, the spectacle of global diplomacy is good for business
summary: The World Economic Forum kicks off on Tuesday in the Swiss Alpine resort. For paying participants, this is above all an opportunity for fruitful informal exchanges.
